title: Graph of electric field from ceter of cylinder

content.question: Charge is distributed uniformly throughout a long nonconducting cylinder of radius R. Which of the following graphs best represents the magnitude of the resulting electric field E as a function of r, the distance from the axis of the cylinder?

choices.label: Option A shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase r, the vertical axis is labeled E, and the origin is labeled O. There is a dashed vertical line approximately one third of the way along the horizontal axis that is labeled uppercase R. The curve starts at the origin and is a straight line up and to the right until it meets the vertical dashed line near the top of the graph. After the dashed line the curve is then concave up and extends down and to the right.

Option B shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase r, the vertical axis is labeled E, and the origin is labeled O. There is a dashed vertical line approximately one third of the way along the horizontal axis that is labeled uppercase R. The curve starts near the top of the graph and extends horizontally to the right until it meets the vertical dashed line. After the dashed line the curve is then concave up and extends down and to the right and levels off at the right end of the horizontal axis.

Option C shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase r, the vertical axis is labeled E, and the origin is labeled O. There is a dashed vertical line approximately one third of the way along the horizontal axis that is labeled uppercase R. The curve starts at the origin and is a straight line up and to the right until it meets the vertical dashed line near the top of the graph. After the dashed line the curve is then a straight line down and to the right, ending near the right end of the horizontal axis.

Option D shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase r, the vertical axis is labeled E, and the origin is labeled O. There is a dashed vertical line approximately one third of the way along the horizontal axis that is labeled uppercase R. The curve starts at the origin and is concave up extending up and to the right until it meets the vertical dashed line near the top of the graph. After the dashed line the curve is then concave up and extends down and to the right and levels off at the right end of the horizontal axis.

Option E shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase r, the vertical axis is labeled E, and the origin is labeled O. There is a dashed vertical line approximately one third of the way along the horizontal axis that is labeled uppercase R. The curve starts at the origin on the horizontal axis and extends to the right until it meets the dashed vertical line. Then the curve extends vertically up until it is almost at the top of the graph. After the dashed line the curve is then concave up and extends down and to the right and levels off at the right end of the horizontal axis.

content.answer: Option A shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase r, the vertical axis is labeled E, and the origin is labeled O. There is a dashed vertical line approximately one third of the way along the horizontal axis that is labeled uppercase R. The curve starts at the origin and is a straight line up and to the right until it meets the vertical dashed line near the top of the graph. After the dashed line the curve is then concave up and extends down and to the right.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
